action.action-desc: Mr. Tuberville (for himself, Mrs. Hyde-Smith, and Mr. Justice) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Commodity Exchange Act to prohibit interference in United States digital commodity markets by entities organized or established in a foreign adversary, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Prohibiting Foreign Adversary Interference in Cryptocurrency Markets Act.

section.header: Prohibition on registration of foreign adversary-affiliated digital commodity platforms
section.text: Section 4(b) of the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 6(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on registration of foreign adversary-affiliated digital commodity platforms

subclause.text: an entity that is established or organized under the laws of, or the principal place of business of which is located in, a foreign adversary; and
any subsidiary owned (in whole or in part) or operated by an entity described in subclause (I).
The term digital commodity means a fungible digital form of personal property that can be possessed and transferred person-to-person without necessary reliance on an intermediary.
The term digital commodity includes property commonly known as cryptocurrency or virtual currency.
The term digital commodity does not include—

item.text: an interest in a physical commodity;
a digital form of currency backed by the full faith and credit of the United States; or
any other instrument that the Commission determines not to be a digital commodity.

subclause.text: The term digital commodity broker means a person that is engaged, as an identifiable business, in—

item.text: soliciting or accepting orders on behalf of another person for a digital commodity trade;
accepting digital commodities from another person for the purpose of entering into digital commodity trades;
arranging digital commodity trades on behalf of another person; or
a similar activity, as determined by the Commission.

subclause.text: The term digital commodity broker does not include a person solely because that person validates digital commodity transactions.

clause.text: The term digital commodity custodian means a person that, as an identifiable business, maintains possession, custody, or control over digital commodities on behalf of another person.

subclause.text: The term digital commodity dealer means a person that—

item.text: has an identifiable business of dealing in a digital commodity as principal for its own account;
makes a market in a digital commodity;
holds itself out as a dealer in a digital commodity;
has as an identifiable business of buying or selling digital commodities for conversion into other digital commodities, currency, or other consideration;

has as an identifiable business of accepting digital commodities from another person (referred to in this item as a depositor) with an obligation to return to the depositor the digital commodities, consideration linked to the digital commodities, or both; or
engages in a similar activity, as determined by the Commission.

subclause.text: The term digital commodity dealer does not include a person solely because that person validates digital commodity transactions.

clause.text: The term digital commodity platform means a person that is 1 or more of the following:

subclause.text: A digital commodity broker.
A digital commodity custodian.
A digital commodity dealer.
A digital commodity trading facility.
The term digital commodity trade means a purchase or sale of a digital commodity in exchange for—
The term digital commodity trade includes—

item.text: an offer to enter into a purchase or sale described in subclause (I); and
a loan of a digital commodity, an offer to enter into a loan of a digital commodity, or a similar activity, as determined by the Commission.

subclause.text: The term digital commodity trading facility means a trading facility that facilitates the execution or trading of digital commodity trades between persons.
The term digital commodity trading facility does not include a person solely because that person validates digital commodity transactions.
the People’s Republic of China, including the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and the Macao Special Administrative Region;
the Republic of Cuba;
the Islamic Republic of Iran;
the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea;
the Russian Federation; and
the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela under the regime of Nicolás Maduro Moros.

subparagraph.text: The Commission shall not register under this Act a digital commodity platform that is owned (in whole or in part) by a covered entity.
The Commission shall revoke the registration under this Act of a digital commodity platform if a covered entity acquires all or any part of the ownership of the digital commodity platform.
